meanings.definition: To remove armor or weapons from
meanings.sent1: He will unarm before entering the peaceful village.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers unarm before going to sleep in the barracks.
meanings.sent3: The knight had to unarm quickly to scratch an itch.
meanings.sent4: She felt unarming her heart was the only way to find true love.
meanings.sent5: The superhero had to unarm to show his true identity.

meanings.sent1: The magician used his powers to unarm the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to unarm the suspect without causing harm.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to unarm the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to unarm even the toughest critics.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful protest aimed to unarm the oppressive regime.
